result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R Vachalek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Credit For Time Served 0 Days.

miscConds.notes: Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Maintain valid driver's license.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Complete an Anger Management and Victim Impact Course.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  15 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED and to be used at the Agent's discretion.
Community Service to be completed by 12-18-2015.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel R Vachalek

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

Defendant Daniel R Vachalek in court with attorney David John Molter.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
